result.execSummary:
The defendant Lyle K Medelberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.  The remaining balance of the costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  DNA Sample to be provided no later than December 1, 2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lyle K Medelberg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Nagel:  Assessment completed and in compliance in Wisconsin.  Illinois still has a hold on him and he must go thru the process with Illinois in order to reinstate here in Wisconsin.  Illinois has him in a lifetime revocation that his client may be able to petition around, unknown how Illinois will respond, long process.  The Court:  Schedule P/S with counsel appearing via telephone with Authorization. Counsel willing to proceed today to resolution.  Case formally called w/Court Reporter at 1:37 PM:  Same appearances as previously noted.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Atty Nagel agrees w/State's recital.  NC plea tendered on behalf of Defendant.  Plea is supported by probable cause in the Complaint.  Court accepts NC plea and enters JOC.  Allocution offered by Atty Nagel.  The Court:  Will accept resolution and impose Court Costs only.  60 DTP or PP.  Bond to be applied.  As to DNA Sample requirement - Def to make arrangements with the WCJ, no later than 12/1/2015.   Atty Nagel states it may be possible to arrange thru the Dane Co Jail.  Sample in some way to be provided no later than 12/1/2015.  Appeal Rights and Order to Provide DNA sample faxed to Atty Nagel.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE is working toward obtaining a valid DL.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant Lyle K Medelberg in court, in person, with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Nagel:  Awaiting offer from the State and is in the process of helping Def with reinstatement of driving privileges.  STC rescheduled and NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:35 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case Called @ 3:12 PM: Defendant Lyle K Medelberg in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and will retain his own counsel.   Court will proceed with that understanding that counsel will be retained.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
